div.p:
86 Virginia Road,
White Plains, NY 10603
Tel: (914) 683-5035

td.a: Governor Extends School Closure to May 15

img.br: "New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that statewide state-at-home measures will continue through May 15, 2020. This means that Valhalla Schools will remain closed until at least that date. The governor extended the shutdown in partnership with six nearby northeast states."

td.a: VMS Releases New Issue of "Chronicle" Newspaper

img.br: Valhalla Middle School's Newspaper Club has published the "Remote Learning" issue of "The Chronicle." It is filled with student-written stories about the "Soup-er Bowl," social media trends, homework, assigned seating and the bowling club. The nine-member staff is delighted to share this digital-only edition with the community.

td.a: "In the Dugout" with VHS Senior Robert Carbone

img.br:
Valhalla High School senior Robert Carbone was profiled in lohud's "In the Dugout,"​​​​​​​ which highlights the Spring 2020 season's top 12th-grade players.
On optimism: "Our team has a good mix of young players and seniors that bond together well. We have a team full of grinders that never let down."

td.a: Ten Valhalla Student Artists Showcase Work in Katonah Museum

img.br: As a young girl, Valhalla High School senior Jennifer Jacobs folded a sheet of paper into three sections. Playing a creative illustration game, she drew the head and shoulders of a person onto the top third. She then folded the paper so that her drawing was hidden and the blank, middle section of paper was showing. She gave the sheet to her father, who sketched the torso and arms there. He then hid his creation and passed it back to his daughter so that she could pencil in the legs and feet. When finished, they opened the paper to reveal a discombobulated creature and giggled at their final product.

From staff members showing gratitude and parents receiving special phone calls about their students to children dressing up and participating in educational activities, the Valhalla Union Free School District celebrated the 100th Day of School with plenty of spirit.
"New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that all schools statewide will remain closed until April 29, 2020, as the efforts to combat coronavirus continue."

We received an update this morning that June’s Regents Exams will be canceled due to the continuing spread of coronavirus.
This news came from New York State Board of Regents Chancellor Betty Rosa in a virtual meeting this morning, April 6, 2020. Further information will be shared on Tuesday, April 7, 2020, which is expected to detail the impact on high schools and their students.

"In order to comply with the Executive Order 202.11, Valhalla Schools is legally required to continue its remote learning for students during the week of April 6-10. Valhalla’s Leadership Team has spent the last few days determining how best to proceed with our remote learning plan. This may look differently at each building level. Your building principals will send out further guidance to you by the week’s end."
